data.title: Repatriation and Integration Center
data.meta_description: In order to effectively organize the process of repatriation and ensure rapid integration into Armenian society, the Office of the High Commissioner for Diaspora Affairs will establish a first-of-its-kind Repatriation and Integration Center, which will serve as a comprehensive resource center to aid potential repatriates with every aspect of moving their lives, families, and business ventures to Armenia, demystifying a process that may otherwise be perceived as complicated, conflicting, and inaccessible.
data.text:
About the Center

In order to effectively organize the process of repatriation and ensure rapid integration into Armenian society, the Office of the High Commissioner for Diaspora Affairs has established a first-of-its-kind Repatriation and Integration Center, which serves as a comprehensive resource center to aid potential repatriates with every aspect of moving their lives, families, and business ventures to Armenia, demystifying a process that may otherwise be perceived as complicated, conflicting, and inaccessible.

The goals of the Repatriation and Integration Center are to promote repatriation, ease the repatriation process, and ensure a smoother integration process for Diaspora Armenians moving to the homeland.

Individualized Support

The Repatriation and Integration Center (Center) offers access to highly trained representatives that provide individualized support in every aspect of the repatriation process, from pre-departure and moving, to settling into life in Armenia.

Integration Support Specialists liaise with various government and non-governmental organizations to find appropriate solutions to all repatriation issues.

Each repatriate, or family of repatriates thinking about moving to Armenia is assigned an Integration Support Specialist who serves as their primary point of contact throughout the entire process and manage their case.

Dominant languages in the Diaspora are accommodated, including Eastern and Western Armenian, English, and Russian.

The Integration Support Specialists provide consultation and practical support in the following areas:

citizenship and residency permits

moving personal belongings and business equipment

healthcare

education and culture

social services

employment and work permits

military conscription and service

taxes, registration, licensing

banking and finance

housing

Integration

To ensure the full integration of repatriates, the Repatriation and Integration Center works closely with our partners at Repat Armenia to help repatriates find employment in Armenia, as well as regularly organizes virtual and in-person forums, networking events, job fairs, and professional training courses.

The Center also provides free of charge Eastern Armenian language classes. The classes are now available, check out: http://diaspora.gov.am/en/pages/137/learn-Armenian.

Location

The Center is located in the heart of Yerevan, at 37 Hanrapetutyan Street. The historic building that houses our partners, Repat Armenia and Birthright Armenia. The fully renovated space is provided by the Hovnanian Family Foundation to the Office of the High Commissioner free of charge!

Contacts

If you have any questions, please contact us by phone at +374 10 515532; +374 77 998123 or by email at repatriation@gov.am.
